newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria's Kaduna refinery for maintenance in July.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria's Kaduna refinery for maintenance in July.

text.p: Nigeria's Kaduna oil refinery, the only such facility in the northern part of the country, will undergo a mandatory turn around maintenance in July, said the managing director of the plant, Morrison Tamuno.
State-owned News Agency of Nigeria said he told the staff of the refinery Thursday that oil minister Dan Etete approved the maintenance work, which should been undertaken since 1991.
Discussions were already on between Kaduna refinery and contractors to handle the job, and approval was given to provide the refinery with two additional boilers.
Tamuno said rehabilitation work on the lube section of the plant which was destroyed by a fire in 1994 had also been awarded to contractors.
The 110,000-barrel-per-day refinery is, like Nigeria's other three refineries, producing below capacity because of poor management and reduced allocation of crude oil to them.
The poor performance of the refineries is partly responsible for a fuel shortage that plagued Nigeria recently, lasting for more than three weeks.
